youth.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the period of time when someone is young, especially the period when someone is a teenager
youth.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Many of these people had used drugs in their youth.
youth.translation[0].definitions[0].note: In everyday English, people usually say when I was young, rather than saying in my youth:
They were friends when they were young.
youth.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a teenage boy – used especially in newspapers to show disapproval
youth.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The youth of today are the pensioners of tomorrow.
youth.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: the quality or state of being young
youth.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Despite his youth, he had travelled alone.
The cream will restore youth and vitality to your skin.
youth.translation[0].note_box[0].section: She spent her youth in India.
